thread.title: Tax revenue from Ohio casinos down slightly in 2nd quarter
thread.title_full: Tax revenue from Ohio casinos down slightly in 2nd quarter

title: Tax revenue from Ohio casinos down slightly in 2nd quarter
text:
Tax revenue from Ohio casinos $64.2 million in 2nd quarter, down slightly from last quarter 
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS Published: 7/25/15 6:30 am EDT - Updated: 7/25/15 6:34 am EDT 
COLUMBUS, Ohio â€” New figures from the state show that Ohio's four casinos produced about 7 percent less tax revenue in the second quarter of this year. 
The Ohio Department of Taxation reports that $64.2 million was collected in tax revenue in April, May and June. That was $4.6 million less than in the first quarter of 2015, but nearly the same as in the last quarter of 2014. 
The Columbus Dispatch ( http://bit.ly/1g9vErC ) reports that of those proceeds, Cleveland will receive $2.62 million, Columbus will get nearly $2.6 million, Cincinnati $1.89 million, and Toledo $1.4 million. The money is distributed to cities, counties, schools and other agencies. 
The money comes from a 33 percent tax assessed on casinos. The total doesn't include proceeds from the state's seven racinos. 
Information from: The Columbus Dispatch, http://www.dispatch.com
